title: 106_hr263
content: The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" imposes an excise tax on individuals acquiring structured settlement payments in factoring transactions, as outlined in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This new chapter addresses structured settlement factoring transactions. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" imposes a 50 percent tax on individuals acquiring structured settlement payment rights in factoring transactions, with exceptions for court-approved hardship cases. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" allows transfers of structured settlement payments if approved by a court or administrative authority due to extraordinary needs of the recipient or their dependents. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" allows transfers of structured settlement payments established by suit or agreement for periodic payment of damages or compensation under workers' compensation acts, which are excludable from the recipient's gross income. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" allows transfers of structured settlement payments established by suit or agreement for periodic payment of damages or compensation under workers' compensation acts, which are excludable from the recipient's gross income if certain conditions are met. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" defines structured settlement payment rights as rights to receive payments under a structured settlement and structured settlement factoring transaction as a transfer of such rights for consideration. The "Structured Settlement Protection Act" defines structured settlement payment rights as rights to receive payments under a structured settlement and structured settlement factoring transaction as a transfer of such rights for consideration. The term 'factoring discount' refers to the excess of the undiscounted amount of structured settlement payments being acquired over the total amount paid by the acquirer. The term 'relevant court or administrative authority' in the Structured Settlement Protection Act refers to the court or administrative body with jurisdiction over the underlying action or proceeding resolved by the structured settlement. The relevant court or administrative authority with jurisdiction over the claim subject to the structured settlement must coordinate with sections 72, 130, and 461(h) requirements. After satisfying the requirements of sections 72, 130, and 461(h) at the time of entering into a structured settlement, any subsequent structured settlement factoring transaction will not impact the application of these provisions to the parties involved, including an assignee under a qualified assignment under section 130. The Secretary is authorized to create regulations to clarify the treatment of amounts received in the event of a structured settlement factoring transaction. The IRS is authorized to create regulations for the treatment of amounts received in structured settlement factoring transactions. SEC. 6050T. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS REGARDING STRUCTURED SETTLEMENT FACTORING TRANSACTIONS. In structured settlement factoring transactions, the person making the payments must provide a written statement to the acquirer of the payment rights as required by section 6041, or be subject to tax under section 5891. In structured settlement factoring transactions, the person making the payments must provide a written statement to the acquirer of the payment rights as required by section 6041 or be subject to tax under section 5891. The reporting obligations of the person making the structured settlement payments are established by this section in place of any other provisions in the event of a structured settlement factoring. The reporting obligations of the person making structured settlement payments in a factoring transaction are defined in this section, exempting them from withholding provisions. The term 'acquirer of the structured settlement payment rights' includes persons described in section 7701(a)(1). The table of sections is amended to include reporting requirements for structured settlement factoring transactions under Sec. 6050T. The amendments made by this section apply to structured settlement factoring transactions occurring after the date of enactment of this Act.
